name: Market Power in Agricultural Land Markets: Concepts and Empirical Challenges
abstract: This paper provides a review about challenges and opportunities to assess and quantify market power in agricultural land markets. Measuring land market power is challenging because the characteristics of this production factor hinder the direct application of familiar concepts from commodity markets. The study uses a case study for the Federal State of Brandenburg in Germany to illustrate these challenges.
subject: Agricultural Economics
Land Use
citation: Balmann, A., Graubner, M., Müller, D., Hüttel, S., Seifert, S., Odening, M., Plogmann, J., & Ritter, M. (2021). Market Power in Agricultural Land Markets: Concepts and Empirical Challenges. German Journal of Agricultural Economics (GJAE), 70(4), 213-218. https://doi.org/10.30430/gjae.2021.0117

dataset.name: Brandenburg Land Market Data
dataset.description: Empirical analysis of land sales and market power in the Federal State of Brandenburg, Germany.

variable_measured.name: land use concentration
variable_measured.description: Degree of land use concentration in the region

extraction_metadata.reasoning: The extraction process involved identifying key metadata elements from the provided text, focusing on bibliographic details and dataset information related to farmland markets. The article's title, authors, affiliations, and abstract were clearly stated, allowing for accurate extraction. The DOI was explicitly mentioned, ensuring precise identification of the article. The abstract provided insights into the study's focus on market power in agricultural land markets, which guided the identification of relevant datasets. However, specific datasets were not detailed in the text, so dataset metadata is limited to the general description of the study's empirical focus on Brandenburg, Germany.
